course_title: Understanding Mental Health and Psychotherapeutic Interventions

learning_outcomes.description: Understand and critique contemporary and historical approaches to mental health and mental illness.
Understand and critique contemporary and historical systems of diagnosis in mental health and psychotherapy.
Understand and critique contemporary treatment approaches in mental health and psychotherapy practice.
Critically understand the role of evidence-based practice in mental health and psychotherapy, both current and developing.

assessments.task_description:
PXMH7101: Assignment 1

Mental Health and Mental Illness

Both mental health and mental illness are contested terms. Articulate your current understanding of the most appropriate ways of defining these terms considering authoritative published guidelines, professional and research literature, experiences of people who have experienced mental illness diagnosis and treatment and other sources which you consider contribute to your current understanding of these terms. Contrast your understanding with a perspective shared by a colleague during the workshops. This essay should demonstrate your capacity to critically examine a range of sources of information about a contested topic and articulate, in an academic format, your own position.

Essay is 1500 words (+/-10%), formatted in an appropriate academic style and using APA 7th referencing. Submission via Turnitin.

Criteria and Marking

Student has presented their own current understanding of mental health and mental illness.

Student has demonstrated capacity to critically examine key sources such as authoritative published guidelines, professional and research literature, and lived experience accounts, and integrated information from these sources into their own understanding of these terms.

Student contrasts their personal understandings with a specific example of a perspective voiced by a colleague during the workshop

Essay is 1500 words (+/-10%), is written in an appropriate academic format and uses APA 7th referencing

Assignment Weighting: 30%

Please consult with staff for legitimate use of AI for this essay. The course coordinator or tutor might organise an oral examination of the essay to confirm authorship and verify learnings acquired through its elaboration. Please check https://guides.library.uq.edu.au/tools-and-techniques/ai-student-hub/ai-for-assessment

assessments.task_description:
Task: Diagnosis in mental health practice is used to communicate with other professionals and to guide the treatment of mental health problems. Diagnostic systems are criticised on a range of fronts, not least of which is that categorical systems are frequently a poor fit for painting an accurate picture of an individual’s personal experience of mental illness or psychological distress. The most dominant system of diagnosis for mental health is the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-V-TR).

Select a specific diagnosis from the DSM-V-TR (e.g. Generalised Anxiety Disorder, not ‘anxiety’). Write a 2500-word analytical essay exploring how the diagnostic approach of the DSM-V-TR assists, or does not assist in:

  • understanding the difficulties which have brought an individual into treatment for this condition, and
  • determining the most appropriate pathway forward.

Contrast your findings with an alternative nosological approach (for instance, the Psychodynamic Diagnostic Manual [PDM-2]) and from your research develop a compelling conclusion as to the role of diagnosis in mental health practice. 

Please consult with staff for legitimate use of AI for this essay. The course coordinator or tutor might organise an oral examination of the essay to confirm authorship of the essay and verify learnings acquired through its elaboration. Please check https://guides.library.uq.edu.au/tools-and-techniques/ai-student-hub/ai-for-assessment

Criteria & Marking:

1. Using the diagnostic criteria, evaluate how the nosological approach of the DSM-V-TR assists or does not assist in understanding the difficulties which have brought an individual into treatment for your chosen condition, and determining the most appropriate pathway forward

2. Compare and contrast your findings with the approach taken by an appropriate alternative nosological framework in understanding the symptoms and personal experience of the consumer with your chosen condition

3. Using your experience of evaluating these diagnostic approaches, as well as literature on diagnosis from a research, clinical and lived-experience perspective, present your critical evaluation of the role of diagnosis in mental health practice.

5. Essay is in an appropriate academic form and structure, uses formatting that assists in clarifying the evidence and the argument relying on that evidence, is well written and free from grammatical and spelling errors, uses a standard referencing format and is 2500 words (+/- 10%).

assessments.task_description:
Evidence-based practice underpins contemporary mental health treatment. The argument is that if empirical research has supported the efficacy of a treatment, it must be effective. This position is flawed as empirical research typically demonstrates reliable clinical change only for a percentage of consumers. In essence, no treatment works for everyone to the same degree.

Choose a diagnostic disorder from the DSM-V-TR (NOT "Depression") and examine the research evidence to assist in deciding about appropriate treatment for this disorder. You should compare two different psychotherapy-based treatment approaches for your chosen disorder. You can choose any two different approaches as long as they have been subject to empirical investigation and the differences between them can be clearly articulated. It is suggested that your chosen treatment approaches should each have a minimum of 4 primary (original data, with consumers) studies to refer to.

Art Therapy Students: Art Therapy students should present on research into an Art Therapy based modality specifically for their chosen disorder. Given the limited pool of research into specific, disorder focused modalities in Art Therapy, students may consider evaluating art-based approaches as a whole for their specific condition.  

Develop a 10-minute presentation for your colleagues and tutor on your findings, including a critical discussion assessing which approach may be most effective and why. Your critical discussion should include an assessment of common factors and shared mechanisms of change across your chosen modalities which might explain equivocal or disparate effectiveness.

You will then facilitate a 5 minute discussion with the class addressing any questions arising from your presentation.

What can be concluded about best EBP with your chosen disorder based on your review?

Criteria & Marking:

1. Student identifies an appropriate DSM-V disorder and identifies two appropriate treatment approaches that have been subject to empirical investigation and the differences between them can be clearly articulated.

2. Student compares and critically evaluates the two different treatment approaches for the chosen disorder and reviews at least 4 studies for each approach (a mix of primary research and meta-analysis or meta-synthesis is acceptable if said reviews explore primary research).

3. Student discusses possible common factors or specific mechanisms of change which might explain equivocal, or disparate treatment efficacy (depending on findings)

4. Student develops conclusions about evidence-based practice with the chosen disorder based on the review.

5. Student has prepared and presented an engaging, informative and thoughtful presentation lasting for 10 minutes and was able to participate authoritatively and clearly in a discussion with colleagues for a minimum of 5 minutes
